column6: Which brand of mobile phone do you currently use?
column7: How long have you had your current mobile phone?
column8: How often do you typically replace your mobile phone?
column9: Are you in a contract that prevents you from keeping your mobile phone for longer?
column10: Have you ever had a mobile device repaired (screen, battery, charging port, etc.)?
column11: Where did you have it repaired?
column12: What types of repair(s) have you had done? (select all that apply)
column13: If you didn’t repair your device when it broke, what was the main reason? (Select up to 2)
column14: How easy do you think it is to have a mobile phone repaired in your area?
column15: Which of the following factors would most increase your likelihood of repairing your phone instead of replacing it? (Select up to 2)
column16: How much would you be willing to pay for a repair compared to the cost of replacing your phone with a new one?
column17: Do you believe manufacturers intentionally make devices more difficult to repair?
column18: How important is it to you that future devices are designed to be repairable?
column19: Have you heard of the "Right to Repair" movement?
column20: Do you support legislation requiring manufacturers to make spare parts and manuals available for independent repair?
column21: If mobile devices were easier and cheaper to repair, how likely would you be to keep your device longer before replacing it?
